en.purpose: This Framingham Risk score is based on the 'Hard' Coronary Framingham outcomes model, which omits co-morbidities and is used to calculate an estimate of the risk of occurence of a heart attack within a 10 year period.
en.use:
The score is calculated differently between males and females and is based on the total sum of 5 of the 7 individual variables with continuous variables discretized. 
The 2 variables that do not contribute to the score directly, are Sex and whether the patient is on BP medications. The 7 variables are:
Age
Sex
Smoker
Total Cholesterol (norm range: 150-200 mg/dL)
HDL Cholesterol (norm range: 40-80 mg/dL)
Sys BP (norm range: 100-120)
BP being treated with medication

Moreover, the scoring for Total Cholesterol and smoker/non-smoker depends on the age bracket the value falls within and scores for sys BP depends on whether the patient is having their BP treated with medication or not.

The scoring system sheets can be seen in (1). Score interpretations can be found in more detail on (2) As example for men:

Score of 5-6                               Relates to 2% 10 year CHD RIsk
Score of 12                                 Relates to 10% 10 year CHD Risk
Score of ≥17                              Relates to > 30% 10 year CHD Risk
en.misuse: The tool should be used with caution when applied to varying populations (as figures are based on the US population over many years). The tool should also be accompanied by other supporting evidence and clinical judgement when utilising the results.

other_details.references:
Ref.1: Wilson PW, et. al. Prediction of Coronary Heart Disease Using Risk Factor Categories. Circulation 1998. 97(18): 1837-1847.

Ref. 2: D'Agostino RB, Sr. Vasan RS, Pencina M.J, Wolf PA, Cobain M, Massaro JM, Kannel WB. (2008) General cardiovascular risk profile for use in primary care: the Framingham Heart Study. Circulation 117(6): 743–753.

when: (($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==1|local::at0054|Yes|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=129,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=120,mm[Hg])))||(($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==0|local::at0053|No|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=159,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=130,mm[Hg])))
then: $gt0075|Systolic BP: men|=1|local::at0047|120-129 if treated or 130-159 if untreated|

when: (($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==1|local::at0054|Yes|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=159,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=130,mm[Hg])))||(($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==0|local::at0053|No|)&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=160,mm[Hg]))
then: $gt0075|Systolic BP: men|=2|local::at0048|130-159 if treated or ≥ 160 if untreated|

when: (($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==0|local::at0053|No|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=159,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=140,mm[Hg])))||(($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==1|local::at0054|Yes|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=129,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=120,mm[Hg])))
then: $gt0076|Systolic BP: women|=3|local::at0103|140-159 if untreated or 120-129 if treated|

when: (($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==0|local::at0053|No|)&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=160,mm[Hg]))||(($gt0016|Blood Pressure treated with medication|==1|local::at0054|Yes|)&&(($gt0010|Systolic|<=139,mm[Hg])&&($gt0010|Systolic|>=130,mm[Hg])))
then: $gt0076|Systolic BP: women|=4|local::at0104|≥ 160 if untreated or 130-139 if treated|

gt0001.description: The Framingham CHD (Coronary Artery Disease)  Risk Score estimates the risk of heart attack in 10 years.

gt0006.description: Age in years, and for babies: months, weeks or days

gt0010.description: Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.

gt0012.description: The total cholesterol concentration in the sample.

gt0016.description: Whether treated by BP medication or not

gt0018.description: Age scores for men dependant on several discretized age brackets, which range from -9 to 13

gt0019.description: Age scores for women dependant on several discretized age brackets, which range from -7 to 16

gt0020.description: Scores for men in this smoking variable vary depending on age or whether smoker or non smoker

gt0021.description: Scores for women in this smoking variable vary depending on age or whether smoker or non smoker

gt0022.description: Total Cholesterol (mg/dL) scores for men, dependant on age values as indicated

gt0023.description: Total Cholesterol (mg/dL) scores for women dependant on age values as indicated

gt0024.description: HDL (mg/dL) discrete values for both men and women - the score ranges from -1 to 2

gt0030.description: Sum of individual scores for men

gt0031.description: Sum of individual scores for women

gt0049.text: Score 0 - Men: Total cholesterol 160-239 mg/dL 70-79 yrs

gt0062.text: Score 1 - Women: Tot chol 160-199 (60-79yrs) or 200-239 (70-79 yrs)

gt0063.text: Score 2 - Women: Tot chol 160-199 (50-59 yrs) or 200-239 (60-69 yrs) or >= 240 (70-79 yrs)

gt0064.text: Score 3 - Women: Tot chol 160-199 (40-49 yrs) 240-279 (60-69 yrs)

gt0065.text: Score 4 - Women: Tot chol 160-199 (20-39 yrs) or 200-239 (50-59 yrs) or >= 280 (60-69 yrs)

gt0069.text: Score 8 - Women: Tot chol 200-239 (20-39 yrs) or 240-279 (40-49 yrs)

gt0075.description: Sys BP scores for men dependant upon patient being on BP medication or not

gt0076.description: Sys BP scores for women dependant upon patient not being on BP medication or not

gt0097.text: Set age score 0 for men 40-44 years

gt0098.text: Set age score 3 for men 45-49 years

gt0099.text: Set age score 6 for men 50-54 years

gt0100.text: Set age score 8 for men 55-59 years

gt0101.text: Set age score 10 for men 60-64 years

gt0102.text: Set age score 11 for men 65-69 years

gt0103.text: Set age score 12 for men 70-74 years

gt0104.text: Set age score 13 for men 75-79 years

gt0105.text: Set age score -9 for men 20-34 years

gt0106.text: Set age score -4 for men 35-39 years

gt0108.text: Set age score 0 for women 40-44 years

gt0109.text: Set age score 3  for women 45-49 years

gt0110.text: Set age score 6  for women 50-54 years

gt0111.text: Set age score 8  for women 55-59 years

gt0112.text: Set age score 10  for women 60-64 years

gt0113.text: Set age score 12  for women 65-69 years

gt0114.text: Set age score 14  for women 70-74 years

gt0115.text: Set age score 16  for women 75-79 years

gt0116.text: Set age score -7  for women 20-34 years

gt0117.text: Set age score -3  for women 35-39 years

gt0125.description: Framingham risk score result interpretation for men

gt0126.description: Framingham risk score result interpretation for women
